s.text: There is really no gracious way to receive a pie in the face ...
There is really no gracious way to receive a pie in the face ...
There is really no gracious way to receive a pie in the face ...
If the private sector does not devise ways to sell, and so limit, use of the Net, the government will surely find a way to tax it.
There is really no gracious way to receive a pie in the face ...
Someone will have a great incentive to sell speedy access, as free access becomes slower, and find a way to do it.
Recently Bill Gates received a pie in the face from what I assume were self-proclaimed enemies.
There is really no gracious way to receive a pie in the face ...
